tweets.text:
This shocking picture is a yard filled with illegally dumped construction and demolition waste. #WasteCrime harms our environment and economy. Make sure you dispose of construction waste legally, or risk being fined up to ¬£50,000 or face jail.

Read more: https://t.co/wMYPlu9tFt https://t.co/jE9enBIM9Z

As part of our ongoing regulation of the @RedIndustries2 #WalleysQuarry landfill site in #Silverdale #NewcastleUnderLyme we have carried out an audit and issued the company with a Compliance Assessment Report.

Read more üëâ https://t.co/o558iAVicn https://t.co/gyKH2icf6z

@Ofwat according to @EnvAgency you are responsible for authorising bulk transfer of water.

Why exactly is @Cambswater allowed to bulk supply anybody? https://t.co/RZcw6Xjc27 https://t.co/FJZHVUO51m

Over six years ago we predicted HS2 would make their application to @EnvAgency to approve tunnelling at the last moment and sure enough they have. Why did they do this? purely to avoid public scrutiny of this highly dubious activity that puts rivers and drinking water at risk.

urls.title: Don‚Äôt dump it ‚Äì sort it!
urls.description: Waste and what to do with it can be a complex and confusing issue, especially when it‚Äôs not your business.

tweets.text:
Are you doing the right thing with building site waste? Waste criminals often take this waste and dump it illegally.

You're responsible for your waste even if you pass it to someone else. Follow these 4 simple steps to protect yourself from #WasteCrime:
https://t.co/ReD1Pr8Zi5 https://t.co/CxKPluz6cG

Understand the @EnvAgency have received an application from HS2 to approve the environmental permit to allow them to start tunnelling. We are told by the @EnvAgency that this is not be open for consultancy even through there is significant risk to our rivers and water supply.

We‚Äôve delivered our largest ever programme of #flood and coastal defence improvements!

Working with partners, we‚Äôve helped protect over 300,000 homes from flooding and supported communities to become more resilient to #ClimateChange

Read more: https://t.co/5Bgax4pg9n

#FCERM https://t.co/mS2pKBFb18

Last week we spent the day at Smithills in #Bolton with our partners @WoodlandTrust @merseyforest & @ThatsManchester

Here log dams & 90000 üå≥ are helping to reduce #flood risk for communities & create habitat for local wildlife

Watch the full interview üëâhttps://t.co/j5fPgJOl42 https://t.co/2LTyCWX14O

Looks similar to what we saw last year at in May at Shardeloes Lake near Amersham. I wonder if the @EnvAgency were informed. At least at that time of year they were not able to blame it on Algae. https://t.co/aBpJyA2CBf
@EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 Some of the levels of hydrogen sulphide picked up in Silverdale February 2021 from the stink mountain wind! https://t.co/ttvwIlXDPI

Response from @EnvAgencyMids after the operators of the Newcastle landfill linked to 1000s of complaints about a bad smell said it was coming from groundwater, not Walleys Quarry: https://t.co/gwaVnpprgi

tweets.text: @ChichesterDC has just ‚Äòchanged‚Äô the   flood risk ‚Äòassessment‚Äô of its coastal villages to allow more building,  ignoring the advice senior Dutch planners and coastal engineers gave it 20 years ago to make a long term climate resilient plan & not build on land lower than 5m AOD https://t.co/583quklEjv

And while that is being done let‚Äôs look up the definition of ‚Äògaslighting‚Äô. At risk of repeating myself: maybe we will hear something from @EnvAgencyMids about this.. maybe.. perhaps.. @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL https://t.co/a4iieCmjb3

This is the lake that was polluted when @HS2 were drilling bore holes @EnvAgency covered it up saying they saw no signs of pollution so the press stopped looking into it because they believe the Environment Agency really hoping our worst fears do not come to fruition https://t.co/JvR3nxoBmv https://t.co/1QQVCsQ4ie

Beautiful day for a drone flyover at Smardale where last year we planted 800 trees in the floodplain for a Natural Flood Management (#NFM) project. Thanks to funding from @EnvAgencyNW and @westmorlanddale https://t.co/bpNx2xawfY

tweets.text: @grrfy @andymhamilton @AaronBell4NUL @Sotlive @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe @RedIndustries2 We‚Äôre by the covered reservoir in Bradwell, almost the highest point. I‚Äôve never noticed the smell here until recently.

@KevinBrown1170 @suffolkwildlife Hi Kevin, different species were planted at different locations as appropriate but included; alder, goat willow, crack willow, white willow, hazel, hawthorn, native  dogwood, alder buckthorn, dog rose and field maple. Thank youüå≥

We‚Äôre pleased to announce the extension of our contract with @AnglingTrust to deliver vital angling services!

We‚Äôre investing ¬£1.35m of licence income annually to help tackle illegal fishing and increase accessibility of the sport 

üëâhttps://t.co/okmIATrPeh https://t.co/sIc9DXEGgK

#HS2 Tunnel Boring Machines may start work as soon as next month, 
yet the application for the required permissions has only been submitted a couple of weeks ago. The process of granting them needs to be heavily scrutinised. More info & guidance from @PJennings88 to follow soon. https://t.co/Aymy8uxUc1

üì¢ @East_Riding you need to eyeball this excellent article by @kari_paul @guardian immediatelyüëÅÔ∏èüëá

"human feces in an Amazon bag returned to station by a driver"üí©

With stories like this you need to stop further development at #NthFerriby #Melton (UK)

@saveferriby2020 https://t.co/jWoV7fS9jm

@andymhamilton @HibbsA @AaronBell4NUL @Sotlive @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe @RedIndustries2 yep hanford about 4 miles away ,and stinks ,considering hydrogen sulphide is heavier than air and hanford is on top of a hill, that's good going.

A few photos of our recently installed 'Leaky Dam' interventions aboe Pott Shrigley to help alleviate flooding to properties downstream @EnvAgencyNW #NFM #NaturalFloodManagement  #SlowTheFlow #UpperMerseyCatchmentPartnership https://t.co/iZ54HFqBUC

Not only have our #flood schemes better protected 300,000 homes nationally, they have also enhanced our environment

urls.description: Posted: 24/03/21 The Croston Flood Risk Management Scheme was completed in 2017 and has already protected lots of properties in Croston from potential flood damage. Posted: 24/03/21 The Environment Agency and partners have completed more than 700 projects to better protect more than 300,000 homes since 2015. Posted: 19/03/21 Sefton Council, the Environment Agency and United Utilities have signed a joint statement of intent to reassure Maghull communities that they are continuing to work together to

tweets.text: For those concerned about the risk to the chalk aquifer  caused by HS2 tunnelling we need access to see the details the environmental approval application lodged with the @EnvAgency recently. The contact email would be enquiries@environment-agency.gov.uk.

England could face #WaterShortages due to #ClimateChange and population growth by 2050.

We're securing future water supplies through our National Framework for Water Resources.

Join us, and help save water: https://t.co/rPYIVLpgjD

#WorldWaterDay #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/rtYjJfzmOH

It‚Äôs only now that #HS2 are applying to @EnvAgency for permission for tunnelling @CherylGillan @GreenJennyJones @RobBAylesbury @wendover_news @ChilternsAONB @ChilternSociety @Hs2Rebellion @AquiferChalk @bucksfreepress @AylesNews https://t.co/Z8cOLM0JJN

tweets.text:
@Feargal_Sharkey @PJennings88 @EnvAgency "But the plans were on display‚Ä¶‚Äù
‚ÄúOn display? I eventually had to go down to the cellar to find them.‚Äù
‚ÄúThat‚Äôs the display department.‚Äù
‚ÄúWith a flashlight.‚Äù
‚ÄúAh, well, the lights had probably gone.‚Äù
‚ÄúSo had the stairs.‚Äù
‚ÄúBut look, you found the notice, didn‚Äôt you?‚Äù
.. 1/2
@EnvAgencyMids And Whalleys Quarry gets away with it, #StopTheStink

Awake st 5.30 am with the stench from Walleys Landfill waking me up with sore throat, sore throat, stinging eyes, and unbelievable smell. No windows open. Air purifier on. @ClareDinnisEA @DefraGovUK @BorisJohnson @EnvAgencyMids @bbcmtd @thegoodgodabove @AaronBell4NUL üò™ü§Æü§ßüò∑‚ò†

Are you frightened to open a window @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @BorisJohnson @Keir_Starmer @DefraGovUK ? I am. I want to sleep but my unventilated house is full if stale, eggy, toxic, air because of the stench from Walleys Landfill and outside the air is poison. #stopthestink

@EnvAgencyMids Slowly poisoning the people of Newcastle Under Lyme in there own homes should be #illegal you need to focus your attention to dealing with the permit breaches at Whalley‚Äôs Quarry it always stinks so much more at weekends so you need to find out why !!!  @StinkStopthe

@EnvAgencyMids And yet your willing to let the residents including our local trauma hospital, schools and business to be affected daily by the toxic stench from a landfill! About time you started take us serious we are being poisoned dread to think what long term affects this will have

@EnvAgencyMids Stop pretending you care about breaches of environmental laws. If you did, definitive action against @RedIndustries2 would‚Äôve occurred by now and Walley‚Äôs Quarry would‚Äôve been sealed off.

@scottdegg @EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 @StinkStopthe Don‚Äôt forget the significant breach of turning off the gas wells for days at a time because they don‚Äôt want to pay anyone to run them when they are closed. Forever cutting corners eh @RedIndustries2

@scottdegg @EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 @StinkStopthe I don‚Äôt know but I figured out what the penalty is for ALMOST breaching your waste tonnage allowance, the EA over rule OUR LOCAL council and increase the permit for tonnage to STOP @RedIndustries2  breaching, maybe for a breach they‚Äôll get a love2shop voucher and a bottle of wine
